summary: This document is a chain of emails between a Senior Paralegal at FedEx and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, primarily coordinating logistics for the paralegal's potential testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails discuss travel arrangements, COVID protocols, and the authentication of FedEx shipping records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Melissa Gormly
persons.context: FedEx attorney coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the testimony of a FedEx paralegal in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She handles travel logistics and legal representation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial for which FedEx records are being authenticated and a paralegal is being prepared to testify.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject of the search for FedEx shipping records from 2007-2020.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida regarding Epstein/Maxwell records.

connections.description: Gormly, as a FedEx attorney, is involved in the legal process surrounding the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically regarding evidentiary records.
Both are named together as the subjects of a search for FedEx shipping account records spanning 2007-2020.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Planned Witness Testimony
events.description: A FedEx paralegal was planned to fly to New York for potential testimony on the afternoon of December 8th or on December 9th, 2021.

events.title: SDFL Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008, related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Thurgood Marshall US Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, NY, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY was actively preparing a FedEx records custodian to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in late 2021.
FedEx was asked to search for any accounts or shipping data associated with both Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, with records provided from 2007-2020.
A prior 2008 subpoena from the Southern District of Florida to FedEx regarding Epstein was referenced, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.
Email coordination reveals detailed planning for witness travel, COVID testing protocols, and attorney presence during testimony.
